intro: Erigeron unalaschkensis, commonly known as the Alaskan fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. This species typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Erigeron unalaschkensis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is an indicator of arctic tundra ecosystems.
